com.jbion.utils.progress

Class ReDrawnProgressBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jbion.utils.progress.AbstractProgressBar
      • com.jbion.utils.progress.ReDrawnProgressBar
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PercentProgressBar

    public class ReDrawnProgressBar
extends AbstractProgressBar
    A progress bar that is redrawn at each update. It does not need a header to show the user where the bar stops because the end of the bar can be drawn even if the progress is not complete.

    The bar can be redrawn in 2 ways (corresponding to 2 ReDrawnProgressBar.ReDrawModes):

    • ReDrawnProgressBar.ReDrawMode.ERASE: the previous progress bar is erased with backspace or carriage return characters.
    • ReDrawnProgressBar.ReDrawMode.NEW_LINE: prints each new update of the progress bar on a new line. Useful to redraw the bar even in Eclipse console, where ReDrawnProgressBar.ReDrawMode.ERASE mode can't be used.
    Author:
    Joffrey Bion

        mode - The way to redraw this progress bar.
